text: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. ”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “There is no intensity of love or feeling that does not involve the risk of crippling hurt. It is a duty to take this risk, to love and feel without defense or reserve.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “Nobody owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “Silence is only frightening to people who are compulsively verbalizing.”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: The Job: Interviews with William S. Burroughs

text: “Hustlers of the world, there is one mark you cannot beat: the mark inside.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape. ”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “I don't care if people hate my guts; I assume most of them do. The important question is whether they are in a position to do anything about it.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “Whether you sniff it smoke it eat it or shove it up your ass the result is the same: addiction.”
author: william s. burroughs

text: “Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “You were not there for the beginning. You will not be there for the end. Your knowledge of what is going on can only be superficial and relative”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: Naked Lunch

text: “The first and most important thing an individual can do is to become an individual again, decontrol himself, train himself as to what is going on and win back as much independent ground for himself as possible”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “I am not one of those weak-spirited, sappy Americans who want to be liked by all the people around them. I don’t care if people hate my guts; I assume most of them do. The important question is whether they are in a position to do anything about it. My affections, being concentrated over a few people, are not spread all over Hell in a vile attempt to placate sulky, worthless shits.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “When you stop growing you start dying.”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: Junky

text: “Love is a haunting melody that I have never mastered, and I fear I never will.”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “The question is frequently asked: Why does a man become a drug addict? The questions, of course, could be asked: Why did you ever try narcotics? Why did you continue using it long enough to become an addict? You become a narcotics addict because you do not have strong motivations in the other direction. Junk wins by default. I tried it as a matter of curiosity. I drifted along taking shots when I could score. I ended up hooked. Most addicts I have talked to report a similar experience. They did not start using drugs for any reason they can remember. They just drifted along until they got hooked. If you have never been addicted, you can have no clear idea what it means to need junk with the addict’s special need. You don’t decide to be an addict. One morning you wake up sick and you’re an addict. (Junky, Prologue, p. xxxviii)”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: Junky

text: “You know a real friend? Someone you know will look after your cat after you are gone.”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: Last Words: The Final Journals

text: “In the U.S. you have to be a deviant or die of boredom.”
author: William Burroughs

text: “There is nothing more provocative than minding your own business.”
author: William S. Burroughs
title: The Place of Dead Roads

text: “Simplicity, patience, compassion. you reconcile all beings in the world.”
author: Lao Tzu

text: “Knowing others is intelligence; mastering yourself is true power.”

text: “When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.”

text: “The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.”

title: Tao Te Ching

text: “A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.”

title: Tao Te Ching

text: “Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “If you understand others you are smart. If you die without loss, you are eternal.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “The flame that burns Twice as bright burns half as long.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Te Tao Ching

text: “Do not ask your children The extraordinary will take care of itself.”
author: William  Martin
title: The Parent's Tao Te Ching: Ancient Advice for Modern Parents

text: “A leader is best They will say, “We did this ourselves.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “If you try to change it, you will ruin it. Try to hold it, and you will lose it.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “Stop thinking, and end your problems. I drink from the Great Mother's breasts.”
author: Lao-Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “The wise man is one who, knows, what he does not know.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “To understand the limitation of things, desire them.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “Give evil nothing to oppose and it will disappear by itself.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to. If you are not afraid of dying, there is nothing you cannot achieve.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “all streams flow to the sea because it is lower than they are. humility gives it its power. if you want to govern the people, you must place yourself below them. if you want to lead the people, you must learn how to follow them.”
author: Lao Tzu
title: Tao Te Ching

text: “Love This is love.”

text: “Close your mouth, This is the primal identity.”

title: Tao Te Ching: A Literal Translation with an Introduction, Notes, and Commentary

text: “All I can be is me- whoever that is. ”

text: “Make your own dream. There's nothing new under the sun. All the roads lead to Rome. And people cannot provide it for you. I can't wake you up. You can wake you up. I can't cure you. You can cure you.”
author: John Lennon
